titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archibald Bouton Negatives MC.404
titlestmt.author: Aki Snyder

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-06-04 16:20:59 -0400.

physdesc.extent: in 1 manuscript box and a half manuscript box

did.abstract: Archibald Lewis Bouton (1872-1941) was a Professor of Rhetoric (1905-1914), Professor of English (1914-1941), and the Dean of New York University's College of Arts and Science (1914-1935). The Archibald Bouton Negatives (circa 1900-1925) consists of photo negatives documenting Bouton's travels within the United Kingdom, France, and the United States.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Archibald Bouton Negatives (circa 1900-1925) consists of photo negatives documenting Bouton's travels within the United Kingdom, France, and the United States. Locations photographed in this collection include, but are not limited to: London, York, Cambridge, Oxford, Warwick, Edinburgh, Versailles, Paris, Verdun, Reims, Pomona, Boston, Pittsburgh, and New York City.

Negatives related to the United States include negatives #1-7, #41-61 and #93-95. Negatives related to the United Kingdom include negatives #8-40 and negatives #62-82. Negatives related to France include negatives #83-92.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials in this collection are arranged in the order in which they were received. Negatives appear to be arranged roughly by geographic region.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials in this collection were transferred from the New York University Archives Photograph Collection (PHOTO 00001) in May 2024. The accession number associated with this collection is 2024.045.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In May 2024, photo negatives relating to Archibald Bouton's travels were removed from the New York University Archives Photograph Collection (PHOTO 00001) and made into a new collection, MC 404. Materials were rehoused in acid-free boxes and folders. Materials were described on the collection-level and inventoried at the file-level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Archibald Lewis Bouton was born on September 1, 1872 in Cortland, New York. He received his A.B. from Amherst in 1896 and his M.A. from Columbia in 1900. He first came to New York University in 1898 as an instructor of English. In 1901, he became an assistant professor and then a full professor in 1905. He served as the Professor of Rhetoric between 1905-1914. In 1914, Bouton became head of the English department and served in that position until 1941. Between 1914-1935, he was also the Dean of the College of Arts and Science. Bouton died on April 18, 1941 in Pasadena, California after having been Dean of University College for twenty-one years.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Records of the Office of the Dean, University College of Arts and Science (Archibald L. Bouton) (RG 18.0.2)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Archibald Bouton Negatives; MC 404; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Around Cortland, House in Cortland and Around House, New York Apartment (112th Street), Around House - Cortland, and Florida Groups.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: In Cortland, S.S. Arabia, Lichfield, Warwick, Kenilworth, Stratford, and Howardian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Wales, English Lakes, Auchgoyle, Peter Laumont, Kyles of Bute from boat, and Pictures in Kerry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Pictures in Kerry, Edinburgh and vicinity, Stirling and vicinity, Ayr and vicinity, Cannes, Near Cannes, London, Oxford, Elgin, and Cawdor Castle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Culloden, Lamont Family Groups, Inverness to Oban, Oban to Tarbert, Clyde, Dunoon, Melrose, Dryburgh, and Whitfield (N.H.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Cambridge (Mass.), Peterborough (1915), Peterborough (1921), Provincetown (1919), and Cloquet (1916).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Cloquet (1916), St. James (Minn.), Stamford (N.Y.), and 159th St (N.Y.C.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: 2206 Andrews Ave. (N.Y.C.) and House in Cortland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: AB Office in Cortland, Tripe to Pike Co. (P.A.), and 16 Dudley Place.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: 16 Dudley Place, Cemetery Stone - Cortland, Amherst 1917 (Mass.), F.G. Oakley, Interior Abbey, Glastonbury Abbey, Stonehenge and nearby, Salisbury Cathedral, Wells Cathedral and close, Ecclefechan, Flixtore [sic] and nearby, and Cortland (family).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: 2206 Andrews Ave., 16 Dudley Place, Loch Katrina, Ardrishaig, Ardlamont, Berwick-upon-Tweed, Cambridge, London, York, Ely, Boston, and Oxford.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Paris, Châlons-sur-Marne, Verdun and region, Reims and region, Chartres, Versailles, Durban, Luceolu [sic], Voyage to Quebec, and Dausville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The titles of these negatives are: Woodstock, Transcontinental, and Pomona.
